articles.description: Reaction to England's defeat in the Women's World Cup final, plus all the latest news and transfer gossip from the Premier League.
articles.title: 'Gutted' Lionesses set for homecoming, plus Premier League latest

articles.description: The success of England's Lionesses at the Women's World Cup will have a lasting legacy, says record scorer Ellen White.
articles.title: 'Lionesses success will have lasting legacy on society'

articles.description: Wales head coach Warren Gatland names his 33-man squad for the 2023 Rugby World Cup in France.
articles.title: Wales' World Cup squad announcement: Warren Gatland due to name 33-man squad

articles.description: Katarina Johnson-Thompson says winning world heptathlon gold in Budapest is "like being in a dream" on a stellar night for GB in Budapest.
articles.title: 'This time I didn't get my heart broken'

articles.description: Watch the winning moment as Great Britain's Katarina Johnson-Thompson secures heptathlon gold in a thrilling 800m race.
articles.title: Johnson-Thompson wins heptathlon gold in 800m thriller

articles.description: England return from Australia following defeat in the Women's World Cup final - but what will they be looking ahead to now?
articles.title: What next for England and Wiegman after World Cup?

articles.description: It seems likely that Brooks Koepka will be given a spot on the US Ryder Cup team after failing to qualify automatically, writes Iain Carter.
articles.title: Koepka waiting on Ryder Cup pick as team golf looms

articles.description: England's wait to win a first Women's World Cup goes on after defeat by Spain in the 2023 final in Sydney.
articles.title: Spain beat England to win the Women's World Cup

articles.description: Novak Djokovic says his rivalry with Carlos Alcaraz is similar to the one he shared with Rafael Nadal.
articles.title: Djokovic defeats Alcaraz to win Cincinnati Open

articles.description: Everton condemn 'vile' racist abuse of midfielder Amadou Onana following Sunday's 4-0 loss at Aston Villa.
articles.title: Everton condemn 'vile' racist abuse of Onana
